eventName: Such is the Joy of Our Reunion
storyInfo: The Young Chef gives Blaze a special tangerine cake, and Blaze finally puts together the entire truth of her history. Elsewhere, Ning Shu arrives at the Judicial Review Office to have an honest discussion with Yu Cheng in his prison cell about everything to do with an old case from forty years ago.

attributes.content: One tangerine cake... to go, please.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Oh, you're here.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Sending it to Victoria this time as well?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: No... Not sending it. I need to go back right away... Though it's hard to say if I even can go back.
attributes.name: Gu Quan
Gu Quan
attributes.content: This time—

attributes.name: Gu Quan
attributes.content: *cough* *cough* *cough*! Just a snack for the road.
attributes.joined: This time—*cough* *cough* *cough*! Just a snack for the road.

attributes.content: Wow, your cough's gotten pretty bad.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I don't think you should be eating sweets right now. I'll boil you up a bowl of loquat soup.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I'm fine, I'm fine... It's not to do with my lungs.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Doesn't matter where the problem is, you've got to take care of yourself. You seen a doctor about it?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Yes, yes. I don't have much time left, apparently.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: I'd say I'm beyond having to mind what I eat.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: It's fine. Everyone has to die someday.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: I've done pretty much everything I needed to get done—
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: How can you say something like that?!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Didn't you... Didn't you say you still have family in Victoria? They're waiting for you to go home.
attributes.name: Young Chef
Gu Quan
attributes.content: Yes... I held onto hope that I could see them again, but it seems

attributes.name: Gu Quan
attributes.content: *cough*... that won't be happening...
attributes.joined: Yes... I held onto hope that I could see them again, but it seems *cough*... that won't be happening...

attributes.content: I might've been a useless good-for-nothing my entire life, but at least I can say I haven't disgraced what little ideals and righteousness I still have in me.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: But only now that I'm at the end have I realized I owe them far, far too much...
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: *sigh* Isn't that just how people are? Things like that happen from time to time. If you try and be the perfect people pleaser, you're a fool.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: But surely you still want to go home, right?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I want to see them, but if I don't, they'll have easier lives.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: That's just how people are... If you want to get something done, you need to put something down.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Everyone else has put their things down, so I should too...
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: I have been in your care for so many years now, Young Chef. Even my final few words in this reverie of mine are for your ears only.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Then...
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Is there still... something you want?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I want...
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: You need to pay more attention. Look at this spot you swept, it's still covered in ash.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Make sure not to miss any corners either. Anything dirty has to be cleaned. We are moving out soon, and we cannot leave behind any trouble for the house's next owner.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: It is rather late, Mr. Ning. Where are you headed off to?
attributes.name: Ning's Butler

attributes.content: Oh, don't mind me, just going out for a walk.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Mr. Ning's been acting really odd today.
attributes.name: Ning's Servant

attributes.content: Why's he spending his Mid-Autumn Festival watching us clean the house instead of gazing at the moon?
attributes.name: Ning's Servant

attributes.content: That's enough questions out of you. Focus on your sweeping.
attributes.name: Ning's Butler

attributes.content: With such brilliant moonlight tonight, we should give it a pristine spot to land on.
attributes.name: Ning's Butler

attributes.content: How did I... get here...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Grandfather's study?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Her mind lurches on the edge of consciousness. She feels as though she has forgotten something important.
An old book lies upon the desk in silence.
Annals of Yan, Volume 124, Supplement 17... 1062... Since when was there such a book in the Imperial Historical Records?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: ...Grandfather?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: It's been years since there was a criminal thrown into the fifth floor of this prison. What's the story tonight?
attributes.name: Prison Guard A

attributes.content: Assassinating someone at court. The Imperial Guard themselves are dragging the culprit here.
attributes.name: Prison Guard B

attributes.content: What a ruthless—!
attributes.name: Prison Guard A

attributes.content: Shh!
attributes.name: Prison Guard B

attributes.content: Don't think too hard about it, and don't ask too many questions. Just keep a close eye on the culprit. You and I won't be enough to fix any mistakes.
attributes.name: Prison Guard B

attributes.content: It seems that everything I've run into since my return to Baizao has been part of some grand plan.
A trail of clues laid out in front of me like bait, leading towards a dead end.
Not only was the perpetrator highly skilled in kung fu, but they also had intimate knowledge of the Judicial Review Office's layout. They must have been working with Yu Cheng for quite some time.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Yu Cheng asked you to take notes during his trial. This is why you stand here now, and it is also the reason I cannot allow you to participate any further.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Whatever Yu Cheng's plan, you are most certainly a part of it.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Deputy Minister Lin, surely you wouldn't ask if you didn't know the answer already?
attributes.name: Masked Individual

attributes.content: Can you not see the truth, or do you simply pretend you can't because you don't dare to?
attributes.name: Masked Individual

attributes.content: What makes you so dead-set on the case, Censor Jie Zhen?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: As the moons slowly sink into the west, their light passes through the barred window and scatters on the far wall of the cell. The night air condenses into dew, beading on Lin Qingyan's brow.
Were it not for the scent of mold, this prison would actually be a good place to meditate.
Indeed. While I was waiting here, I managed to figure out many things that have been on my mind.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: It was you who set the scrollery on fire.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Was it an answer I gave you here, or one you puzzled out beforehand?
We meet again, Deputy Minister Lin.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Hey, I'm not in the mood to discuss snacks with you right now. I've got people to save!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Calm down, take it easy. Is it any use being so high-strung when you have so much to do?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: What do you know—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: All I know is that if the heat ain't right, don't take off the lid.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: *sigh* You can't skip out on meals if you have something big to do. If you don't eat, you're not getting anything done.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Here, try this. Is this the tangerine cake you're looking for?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: You... Weren't you always saying I wouldn't be able to find it, even if I searched all of Baizao?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I also said I'm the best chef in all of Baizao. As long as the taste exists, I can replicate it.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: And this one's my own creation. It won't count for our bet.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Isn't this the same tangerine cake you made before—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Despite her skepticism, Blaze shoves a cake into her mouth.
She has tried many fine dishes over the last few days, and learned a lot about how to critique food during that time. The cake in front of her cannot be considered 'tasty'.
Xingzhu was right. Too much sugar will overwhelm the fragrance of the tangerine peel, while too much oil destroys the texture of the cake itself.
It is not a tasty snack...
But it is an exact match for the taste in her memories.
How do you...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: How do you know this recipe?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You were so hung up on my tangerine cake not being sweet enough. It got me wondering what kind of chef would make them that sweet.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Then I thought, what if the one who made them so sweet didn't do it for the taste?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: That means...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You said you ate these in Victoria, right?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I'm reminded of a regular customer I had many years ago. He always ordered some tangerine cakes, and said he was going to send some off to his daughter in a foreign land.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I told him they'd spoil long before they got to her.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: But he refused to believe me. He'd process it a bit himself, and wrap it up in layer after layer of letter paper. You could barely tell if it was a letter or some food by the end of it.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: You knew him!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: He came here... I've been searching for him all this time...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Do you... know what happened to him...?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I wouldn't say I knew him. He was just a regular customer of many years.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I vaguely remember him always coming over before it was even bright out to order the cheapest breakfast I had on the menu, then he'd sit by the window, like he was waiting for someone.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Waiting for someone? Who...?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: How should I know? See for yourself.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Day breaks.
The faint full moons brush against the horizon. As the night come to a close, there are perhaps many in slumber, enjoying dreams of happy reunions.
Diligent hawkers are up early setting up their stalls, their shouts echoing down the streets, rousing the sleepers of the metropolis.
Blaze spots a familiar figure by the street corner.
This small restaurant and that serene manor are separated by no more than a street corner. A fact barely worth noticing during normal times.
Was this what he was looking at, year after year?
It's you...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: It's really you...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You're here.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I never thought I would see you again in my lifetime.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: The man leaning against the corner is clothed in near-rags. He grasps a mooncake in his hands, his face awash in crumbs, ignorant of his guest.
A smear of light leaks in through the bars of his cell window, painting the criminal's gaunt face in stark relief.
The Judicial Review Office is truly kind. Even us prisoners get a mooncake for the Mid-Autumn Festival.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: It's delicious. Want a bite?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: No need. I will be having my meals in this prison soon enough. I will have my own to enjoy.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Pity, we still have so much to talk about. It's not quite the same without something to munch on, right?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: The old man lets out a dry laugh, taking a seat across from the shabbily-dressed prisoner.
For decades, you have wanted to ask an old man like me your questions. I suppose today is your lucky day?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: You should hate me, Mr. Ning.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: You were one step away from being able to go back home without a heavy heart, one step away from enjoying your twilight years with your family.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Just one small step... Hahahahaha.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: I really should hate you, when you put it like that. I would like nothing more than to charge at you and tear at your flesh with my teeth.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: But on second thought, you have given up decades of your life and your position as Deputy Minister at the Judicial Review Office for me, spending the rest of your years within this cell.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: No matter how you look at it, it should be you who hates me.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Hahahaha... You're overthinking it, Mr. Ning.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: I said it before, but I was never any good at my job, or at being a decent human being... Not like Gu Quan.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: I'm a glutton, you see, the type that loves sniffing out deep, hidden truths. I tore open shells to get at the flesh, and got addicted to the sweet, sweet taste of marrow. I'll do anything for it, even if it leaves my hands bloodied and my teeth shattered.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: During all these years, you were the biggest, plumpest shellbeast on my dining table. How could I ever hate you?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Even if I were to hate... It wouldn't be for anything on my side.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Your teeth are still in fine shape. I never saw them chip while they were gnawing on my old bones.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: But Yu Cheng, why were you so sure I would have come to see you today?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: If I had just walked away from all this, all your plots and plans would have gone to waste, no?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Hahahaha... Because I understand you. I understand you far too well, Mr. Ning.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: I simply had to gamble, that during the years you spent bobbing around the hierarchy of mandarins, you would dirty your hands, but still retain your humanity.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: You let Gu Quan live on while he was right under your nose, after all, and raised his daughter to boot.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: You care about the fate of that child... Those two children, rather. You wanted to see those girls live carefree, innocent lives while you yet live...
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: You knew that if you did not relent one day, they would never know peace.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: And so you came to see me... You had to.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: You have looked into these matters already... It seems you managed to find out most of what should have been found out.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: How long did it take you?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: I only finished deciphering the clues and piecing them all together last year. It shames me to admit as a deputy minister, but my pace was a bit too slow.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Gu Quan, on the other hand? He managed to figure it all out years ago.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: I never considered that...
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: The year he returned to Baizao, you managed to put him under your watch. But you never thought he would copy decades worth of letters from your home.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: By peering through all those letters between grand mandarins and nobles, he, a ninth-rank ceremonial officer, found every survivor of that murder case. He unraveled the threads and pieced the truth together.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Gu Quan's diligence knew no bounds. I underestimated him.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Anything more you wish to say, Mr. Ning?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Hahahaha... What is there left to say? What sins must be admitted, I shall admit.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: I really did send someone to kill the Minister of Justice who presided over the Grand Preceptor's case.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: But not because he accused me of being the Grand Preceptor's collaborator in treason...
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Rather, because the Grand Preceptor's treason was a miscarriage of justice all along.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Indulge me in my curiosity, Deputy Minister Lin. When did you figure it out?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: I suspected it was you who set Ding Feng Lou alight.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Why? What would I have to do with that incident?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Call it a hunch.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Though you might not have used your kung fu at the time, a mask was not enough to prevent me from thinking that person's figure and skills were familiar. Very familiar.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Afterwards, at the Judicial Review Office, you sought me out and managed to cement this particular suspicion in my mind.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Come to think of it, you must have been in close contact with Yu Cheng as early as when I was preparing to impeach him. I never considered the possibility you were already cooperating with him at the time.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: From the scrollery fire to the hanging scroll in the Ning Manor, and then on to the fire at Ding Feng Lou. This recent string of mysteries was you trying to lead me along a trail of clues, wasn't it?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: That was rather rushed and sloppy, now that I look back.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: And the fire at the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies...?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I must regret to inform you that was not my doing, truly. Merely an unexpected turn that happened to align with our goal.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Why did you two do all this?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Ridiculous as it may sound, this all started with an old case. Not a large one, yet not small either.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: A case I happened upon by chance after I joined the Department of Discipline and Supervision.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: The Minister of Justice, assassinated by a beggar in the middle of the street. A case I could barely believe, yet one hastily closed without meaningful buildup or a satisfying conclusion.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Though the assassin had been executed, his identity, his motive... There were simply too many vague unknowns in the file.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: As I dug deeper, I noticed that every thread led towards an even bigger case, a case that had snipped all those threads short.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: The Grand Preceptor's treason...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You've investigated that case too.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: The betrayal of the three Grand Ministers, a case large enough to shake the court, and one that implicates countless others. Forget finding the truth, even just mentioning the Grand Preceptor's name at the time was the greatest of taboos.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: 'The Grand Preceptor incited the prince to regicide.' This was all the history books had to say on the matter.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: But nobody knows the truth of what happened the night the old True Lung passed away.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Who was it who mobilized the city guard? Who went into the palace?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Only later did I realize I was not the only one looking into this case.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Was this how you got to know Yu Cheng?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Should I rather call it fowlbeasts of a feather, or friendship at first sight?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: You said the two of you weren't able to follow the trail, so how did you determine the Grand Preceptor was wrongly accused?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: It wasn't our research that lead to this conclusion.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: The one who brought everything to light was Gu Quan.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Do you seriously not know why?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Of course I do. I just wanted to ask you how this 'why' tasted when you said it aloud.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: ...The people cry out, their hearts uneasy...
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Only those who have experienced the struggle know that Yan's current peace and prosperity were hard-won.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: It was a very, very long time ago.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: The old True Lung was diligent. At the time, Originium industries were beginning to change the structure of this great land. Even during Yan's turbulent times, he did not allow her to fall behind the other nations of Terra.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: And so it was that a great hero was infected with Oripathy in his twilight years. Believing his days were numbered, his many policies began to stray into bias and imbalance.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: At the time, the prince wished to stop the True Lung... and the Grand Preceptor stood by his side.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: This supposed support was her urging the prince to seize the throne?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: The old True Lung died the night the prince entered the palace to admonish him. As for the prince? His whereabouts since that night are unknown. Such a tumultuous event demanded an explanation.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: ...Which required someone to be charged with everything.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Do you think the current True Lung was unaware of all this...?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Changes in the court naturally lead to unrest among the masses. 'The Purge of Traitors'. A very fitting slogan.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: The then-young True Lung acted with an iron fist to sweep away many courtiers with evil intent, stabilizing the situation as quickly as possible. This ensured this spell of court intrigue never made it outside the walls of the Forbidden City.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: For forty years, I assumed I was the only one aside from the True Lung himself to still remember what transpired.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Until ten or so years after that case ended, that young man stood in front of me once again.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: I fear you speak of that time too lightly, Mr. Ning.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: It was not only traitors who were 'swept away'. There was also the entirety of the Grand Preceptor's family, twenty-eight in all.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: They were all sent to prison. Some committed suicide in their cells to prove their innocence. Those who lived were exiled. I tried to find some trace of them, but it was no use. Couldn't find a single one.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Except for a child... Spirited away during the turmoil, still swaddled in a blanket.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: I never considered the possibility she still lived, yet never truly believed she had died.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: It seems you've met her.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: A few days ago. Her appearance is... not too similar. But their personality? It's like two peas in a pod.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Gu Quan never spoke a word about that child's whereabouts during the decade he spent in Baizao, right up until his death...
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: I'm sure you're now well aware of why he died on the road back to Victoria.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Yu Cheng, you old bastard.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: You used Gu Quan's own death to ensure there was no possibility of anyone finding that child, which also gave you an opportunity to investigate me.
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: At the time I assumed Gu Quan had no success in his exhaustive research into the Grand Preceptor case, which prompted him to leave Baizao in despair.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: It was only after many years that I realized it was not the so-called truth that he sought. He had long since found the answers to those troubles you mentioned earlier.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: What he hoped I would do was something else entirely.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: I don't understand...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Are you telling me you two knew all along that Blaze was the orphan from that case?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Your investigation should have already revealed that Gu Quan and Yu Cheng knew each other.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: After taking the child away, Gu Quan kept the secret of her whereabouts to himself for decades. But before he met his untimely end, he confided in the only 'friend' he had, Yu Cheng.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: After his death, Yu Cheng immediately began to search for her.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: However, he was unable to personally act as deputy minister at the Judicial Review Office. He entrusted the task of performing discreet inquiries to me, far from the center of court politics, so as to not attract attention.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: By the time I found her in Victoria, she was already infected.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: I could not take her back to Baizao right away. For the sake of protecting her, I had no choice but to place her in the care of a medical organization that treated the Infected.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: So it was you...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You were already aligned at the time, I see.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: But you were also part of this plan from early on, Deputy Minister Lin.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: How was it you were able to find Blaze's trail? How were you able to come across those files pertaining to her past? Surely you didn't just attribute them to chance?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Yu Cheng would not have told you these himself. The risk was too great. There could not be a third person who knew of this in all of Terra.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: But he was always searching for a suitable candidate... One with courage, who stood for truth.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: He has long since been ready to give his life for this cause. I am happy to dirty my hands doing what must be done in his stead.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: But it's not enough. We needed someone pure and innocent, one who could use honest means to lay bare the truth.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: It's nearly time.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: We still have one last opportunity.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Do you still wish to bring the truth out into the light of day, Deputy Minister Lin?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen
